extends VISADevice

      SMU.DataPoint[] doLinearSweep(SMU.Source source, double min, double max, int numSteps, long delay, boolean symmetric)
      Performs a linear sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning the V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects
      SMU.DataPoint[] doLinearSweep(SMU.Source source, double min, double max, int numSteps, long delay, boolean symmetric, SMU.ProgressMonitor onUpdate)
      Performs a linear sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning the V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.
      SMU.DataPoint[] doLogarithmicSweep(SMU.Source source, double min, double max, int numSteps, long delay, boolean symmetric)
      Performs a logarithmic sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects.

      Performs a logarithmic sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.
      SMU.DataPoint[] doSweep(SMU.Source source, double[] values, boolean symmetric, long delay)
      Performs a logarithmic sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.
      SMU.DataPoint[] doSweep(SMU.Source source, double[] values, long delay, boolean symmetric, SMU.ProgressMonitor onUpdate)
      Performs a logarithmic sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.

      • doLinearSweep

        public SMU.DataPoint[] doLinearSweep(SMU.Source source,
                                     double min,
                                     double max,
                                     int numSteps,
                                     long delay,
                                     boolean symmetric)
                              throws DeviceException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Performs a linear sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning the V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects
        Parameters:
        source - VOLTAGE or CURRENT
        min - Minimum source value
        max - Maximum source value
        numSteps - Number of steps in sweep
        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        Returns:
        Array of DataPoint objects containing I-V data points
        Throws:
        DeviceException - Upon incompatibility with device
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error

      • doLinearSweep

        public SMU.DataPoint[] doLinearSweep(SMU.Source source,
                                     double min,
                                     double max,
                                     int numSteps,
                                     long delay,
                                     boolean symmetric,
                                     SMU.ProgressMonitor onUpdate)
                              throws DeviceException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Performs a linear sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning the V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.
        Parameters:
        source - VOLTAGE or CURRENT
        min - Minimum source value
        max - Maximum source value
        numSteps - Number of steps in sweep
        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        onUpdate - Method to run each time a new measurement is completed
        Returns:
        Array of DataPoint objects containing I-V data points
        Throws:
        DeviceException - Upon incompatibility with device
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error

        min - Minimum source value
        max - Maximum source value

        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        onUpdate - Method ot run each time a new measurement is completed

      • doSweep

        public SMU.DataPoint[] doSweep(SMU.Source source,
                               double[] values,
                               long delay,
                               boolean symmetric,
                               SMU.ProgressMonitor onUpdate)
                        throws DeviceException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Performs a logarithmic sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.
        Parameters:
        source - VOLTAGE or CURRENT
        values - Array of values to use in the sweep
        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        onUpdate - Method ot run each time a new measurement is completed
        Returns:
        Array of DataPoint objects containing V-I data points
        Throws:
        DeviceException - Upon incompatibility with device
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error

      • doSweep

        public SMU.DataPoint[] doSweep(SMU.Source source,
                               double[] values,
                               boolean symmetric,
                               long delay)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               DeviceException
        Performs a logarithmic sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning V-I data points as an array of DataPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.
        Parameters:
        source - VOLTAGE or CURRENT
        values - Array of values to use in the sweep
        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        Returns:
        Array of DataPoint objects containing V-I data points
        Throws:
        DeviceException - Upon incompatibility with device
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error
